head.title: Ruling Clears Way For Generic Prozac

hedline.hl1: Ruling Clears Way For Generic Prozac

block.p: A federal appeals court ruling cleared the way for the sale of a generic version of Prozac, the world's top-selling antidepressant, as early as next summer, about two years earlier than expected.

The ruling was good news for the 38 million people around the world who have taken Prozac. The generic version could be priced at less than one-third of the current price of the drug. But Eli Lilly, which makes Prozac, said it would appeal the ruling. Lilly sold $2.6 billion of Prozac last year, and the drug now makes up about 26 percent of the company's revenue.
A federal appeals court ruling cleared the way for the sale of a generic version of Prozac, the world's top-selling antidepressant, as early as next summer, about two years earlier than expected.

The ruling was good news for the 38 million people around the world who have taken Prozac. The generic version could be priced at less than one-third of the current price of the drug. But Eli Lilly, which makes Prozac, said it would appeal the ruling. Lilly sold $2.6 billion of Prozac last year, and the drug now makes up about 26 percent of the company's revenue.
Barr Laboratories, which challenged Lilly's patent in court, would be the first drugmaker to sell a generic version of Prozac, and its shares rose by 66 percent. Eli Lilly's stock plunged 29 percent.
